intro: Rinorea palawanensis var. mollis, commonly known as the soft-leaf rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its smooth, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
